byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting from Paris. Alain Delaquérière contributed research.

abstract: France has taken lead in counterterrorism fight against Al Qaeda affiliates in Sahel, section of Sahara dessert that stretches from Senegal to Chad, expanding scope of its efforts to include Boko Haram and reorganizing its approach to handle some of world's harshest terrain.
lead_paragraph: France has joined an increasingly violent campaign to combat Al Qaeda’s affiliate in North Africa and other Islamist extremists, and more recently to thwart Boko Haram.

headline.main: Leading Role for France as Africa Battles Back
headline.print_headline: Leading Role for France as Africa Battles Back

snippet: France has joined an increasingly violent campaign to combat Al Qaeda’s affiliate in North Africa and other Islamist extremists, and more recently to thwart Boko Haram.
